Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: youtube-dl

Arguments.Name: --help
Arguments.Description: Print the help text and exit

Arguments.Name: -U
Arguments.Description: Update this program to latest version. Make sure you have sufficient permissions (run with sudo if needed)

Arguments.Name: --ignore-errors
Arguments.Description: Continue on download errors, for example to skip unavailable videos in a playlist

Arguments.Name: --abort-on-error
Arguments.Description: Abort downloading of further videos (in the playlist or the command line) if an error occurs

Arguments.Name: --extractor-descriptions
Arguments.Description: Output descriptions of all supported extractors

Arguments.Name: --default-search
Arguments.Description: Use this prefix for unqualified URLs. For example "gvsearch2:" downloads two videos from google videos for youtube-dl "large apple"

Arguments.Name: --config-location
Arguments.Description: Location of the configuration file; either the path to the config or its containing directory

Arguments.Name: --force-generic-extractor
Arguments.Description: Force extraction to use the generic extractor

Arguments.Name: --flat-playlist
Arguments.Description: Do not extract the videos of a playlist, only list them

Arguments.Name: --no-mark-watched
Arguments.Description: Do not mark videos watched (YouTube only)

Arguments.Name: --no-color
Arguments.Description: Do not emit color codes in output

Arguments.Name: --proxy
Arguments.Description: Use the specified HTTP/HTTPS/SOCKS proxy. Pass in an empty string for direct connection

Arguments.Name: --socket-timeout
Arguments.Description: Time to wait before giving up, in seconds

Arguments.Name: --source-address
Arguments.Description: Client-side IP address to bind to

Arguments.Name: --geo-verification-proxy
Arguments.Description: Use this proxy to verify the IP address for some geo-restricted sites

Arguments.Name: --geo-bypass
Arguments.Description: Bypass geographic restriction via faking X-Forwarded-For HTTP header

Arguments.Name: --no-geo-bypass
Arguments.Description: Do not bypass geographic restriction via faking X-Forwarded-For HTTP header

Arguments.Name: --geo-bypass-country
Arguments.Description: Force bypass geographic restriction with explicitly provided two-letter ISO 3166-2 county code

Arguments.Name: --geo-bypass-ip-block
Arguments.Description: Force bypass geographic restriction with explicitly provided IP block in CIDR notation

Arguments.Name: --playlist-start
Arguments.Description: Playlist video to start at (default is 1)

Arguments.Name: --playlist-end
Arguments.Description: Playlist video to end at (default is last)

Arguments.Name: --playlist-items
Arguments.Description: Playlist video to end at (default is last)

Arguments.Name: --match-title
Arguments.Description: Download only matching titles (regex or caseless sub-string)

Arguments.Name: --reject-title
Arguments.Description: Skip download for matching titles (regex or caseless sub-string)

Arguments.Name: --min-filesize
Arguments.Description: Do not download any videos smaller than SIZE (e.g. 50k or 44.6)

Arguments.Name: --max-filesize
Arguments.Description: Do not download any videos larger than SIZE (e.g. 50k or 44.6)

Arguments.Name: --date
Arguments.Description: Download only videos uploaded in this date

Arguments.Name: --datebefore
Arguments.Description: Download only videos uploaded on or before this date (i.e. inclusive)

Arguments.Name: --dateafter
Arguments.Description: Download only videos uploaded on or after this date (i.e. inclusive)

Arguments.Name: --min-views
Arguments.Description: Do not download any videos with less than COUNT views

Arguments.Name: --max-views
Arguments.Description: Do not download any videos with more than COUNT views

Arguments.Name: --no-playlist
Arguments.Description: Download only the video, if the URL refers to a video and a playlist

Arguments.Name: --yes-playlist
Arguments.Description: Download the playlist, if the URL refers to a video and a playlist

Arguments.Name: --age-limit
Arguments.Description: Download only videos suitable for the given age

Arguments.Name: --download-archive
Arguments.Description: Download only videos not listed in the archive file. Record the IDs of all downloaded videos in it

Arguments.Name: -r
Arguments.Description: Maximum download rate in bytes per second (e.g. 50K or 4.2M)

Arguments.Name: --fragment-retries
Arguments.Description: Number of retries for a fragment or "infinite"

Arguments.Name: --abort-on-unavailable-fragments
Arguments.Description: Abort downloading when some fragment is not available

Arguments.Name: --keep-fragments
Arguments.Description: Keep downloaded fragments on disk after downloading is finished; fragments are erased by default

Arguments.Name: --no-resize-buffer
Arguments.Description: Do not automatically adjust the buffer size

Arguments.Name: --http-chunk-size
Arguments.Description: Size of a chunk for chunk-based HTTP downloading (e.g. 10385760 or 10M)

Arguments.Name: --playlist-reverse
Arguments.Description: Download playlist videos in reverse order

Arguments.Name: --playlist-random
Arguments.Description: Download playlist videos in random order

Arguments.Name: --xattr-set-filesize
Arguments.Description: Set file xattribute ytdl.filesize with expected file size

Arguments.Name: --hls-prefer-native
Arguments.Description: Use the native HLS downloader instead of ffmpeg

Arguments.Name: --hls-prefer-ffmpeg
Arguments.Description: Use ffmpeg instead of the native HLS downloader

Arguments.Name: --hls-prefer-mpegts
Arguments.Description: Use the mpegts container for HLS videos, allowing to play the video while downloading

Arguments.Name: --external-downloader-args
Arguments.Description: Give these arguments to the external downloader

Arguments.Name: -a
Arguments.Description: File containing URLs to download ('-' for stdin), one URL per line. Lines starting with '#', ';' or ']' are considered as comments and ignored

Arguments.Name: --id
Arguments.Description: Use only video ID in file name

Arguments.Name: --output-na-placeholder
Arguments.Description: Placeholder value for unavailable meta fields in output filename template

Arguments.Name: --restrict-filenames
Arguments.Description: Restrict filenames to only ASCII characters, and avoid "&" and spaces in filenames

Arguments.Name: -c
Arguments.Description: Do not resume partially downloaded files (restart from beginning)

Arguments.Name: --no-part
Arguments.Description: Do not use .part files - write directly into output file

Arguments.Name: --no-mtime
Arguments.Description: Do not use the Last-modified header to set the file modification time

Arguments.Name: --write-description
Arguments.Description: Write video descriptions to a .description file

Arguments.Name: --write-info-json
Arguments.Description: Write video metadata to a .info.json file

Arguments.Name: --write-annotations
Arguments.Description: Write video annotations to a .annotations.xml file

Arguments.Name: --load-info-json
Arguments.Description: JSON file containing the video information (created with the "--write-info-json" option

Arguments.Name: --cookies
Arguments.Description: File to read cookies from and dump cookie jar in

Arguments.Name: --cache-dir
Arguments.Description: Location in the filesystem where youtube-dl can store some downloaded information permanently

Arguments.Name: --write-all-thumbnail
Arguments.Description: Write all thumbnail image formats to disk

Arguments.Name: --list-thumbnails
Arguments.Description: Simulate and list all available thumbnail formats

Arguments.Name: -s
Arguments.Description: Do not download the video and do note write anything to disk

Arguments.Name: --get-thumbnail
Arguments.Description: Simulate, quiet but print thumbnail URL

Arguments.Name: --get-description
Arguments.Description: Simulate, quiet but print video description

Arguments.Name: --get-duration
Arguments.Description: Simulate, quiet but print video length

Arguments.Name: --get-filename
Arguments.Description: Simulate, quiet but print output filename

Arguments.Name: --get-format
Arguments.Description: Simulate, quiet but print output format

Arguments.Name: -J
Arguments.Description: Simulate, quiet but JSON information for each command-line argument

Arguments.Name: --print-json
Arguments.Description: Be quiet and print the video information as JSON (video is still being downloaded)

Arguments.Name: --newline
Arguments.Description: Output the progress bar as new lines

Arguments.Name: --no-progress
Arguments.Description: Do not print the progress bar

Arguments.Name: --dump-pages
Arguments.Description: Print downloaded pages encoded using base64 to debug problems (very verbose)

Arguments.Name: --write-pages
Arguments.Description: Write downloaded intermediary pages to files in the current directory to debug problems

Arguments.Name: --print-traffic
Arguments.Description: Display sent and read HTTP traffic

Arguments.Name: -C
Arguments.Description: Contact the youtube-dl server for debugging

Arguments.Name: --no-call-home
Arguments.Description: Do NOT contact the youtube-dl server for debugging

Arguments.Name: --prefer-insecure
Arguments.Description: Use an unencrypted connection to retrieve information about the video. (Currently supported only for YouTube)

Arguments.Name: --referer
Arguments.Description: Specify a custom referer, use if the video access is restricted to one domain

Arguments.Name: --add-header
Arguments.Description: Specify a custom HTTP header and its value, separated by a colon ':'

Arguments.Name: --bidi-workaround
Arguments.Description: Work around terminals that lack bidirectional text support. Requires bidiv or fribidi executable in PATH

Arguments.Name: --sleep-interval
Arguments.Description: Number of seconds to sleep before each download when used alone or a lower bound of a range for randomized sleep before each download when used along with --max-sleep-interval

Arguments.Name: --max-sleep-interval
Arguments.Description: Upper bound of a range for randomized sleep before each download. Must only be used along with --min- sleep-interval

Arguments.Name: --prefer-free-formats
Arguments.Description: Prefer free video formats unless a specific one is requested

Arguments.Name: -F
Arguments.Description: List all available formats of requested videos

Arguments.Name: --youtube-skip-dash-manifest
Arguments.Description: Do not download the DASH manifests and related data on YouTube videos

Arguments.Name: --merge-output-format
Arguments.Description: If a merge is required (e.g. bestvideo+bestaudio), output to given container format

Arguments.Name: --write-auto-sub
Arguments.Description: Write automatically generated subtitle file (YouTube only)

Arguments.Name: --all-subs
Arguments.Description: Download all the available subtitles of the video

Arguments.Name: --list-subs
Arguments.Description: List all available subtitles for the video

Arguments.Name: --sub-format
Arguments.Description: Subtitle format, accepts formats preference, for example: "srt" or "ass/srt/best"

Arguments.Name: --sub-lang
Arguments.Description: Languages of the subtitles to download (optional) separated by commas

Arguments.Name: -p
Arguments.Description: Account password. If this option is left out, youtube-dl will ask interactively

Arguments.Name: --ap-mso
Arguments.Description: Adobe Pass multiple-system operator (TV provider) identifier

Arguments.Name: --ap-password
Arguments.Description: Multiple-system operator account password. If this option is left out, youtube-dl will ask interactively

Arguments.Name: -x
Arguments.Description: Convert audio files to audio-only files (requires ffmpeg/avconv and ffprobe/avprobe)

Arguments.Name: --audio-quality
Arguments.Description: Specify ffmpeg/avconv audio quality, insert a value between 0 (better) and 9 (worse) for VBR or a specific bitrate like 128K

Arguments.Name: --recode-video
Arguments.Description: Encode the video to another format if necessary

Arguments.Name: --postprocessor-args
Arguments.Description: Give these arguments to the postprocessor

Arguments.Name: -k
Arguments.Description: Keep the video file on disk after the post-processing; the video is erased by default

Arguments.Name: --no-post-overwrites
Arguments.Description: Do not overwrite post-processed files; the post-processed files are overwritten by default

Arguments.Name: --embed-subs
Arguments.Description: Embed subtitles in the video (only for mp4, webm and mkv videos)

Arguments.Name: --embed-thumbnail
Arguments.Description: Embed thumbnail in the audio as cover art

Arguments.Name: --embed-metadata
Arguments.Description: Write metadata to the video file

Arguments.Name: --metadata-from-title
Arguments.Description: Parse additional metadata like song title / artist from the video title. The format syntax is the same as --output. Regular expressions with named capture groups may also be used. The parsed parameters replace existing values

Arguments.Name: --xattrs
Arguments.Description: Write metadata to the video file's xattrs (using dublin core and xdg standards)

Arguments.Name: --fixup
Arguments.Description: Automatically correct known faults of the file

Arguments.Name: detect_or_warn
Arguments.Description: Fix file if we can, warn otherwise

Arguments.Name: --prefer-avconv
Arguments.Description: Prefer avconv over ffmpeg for running the postprocessors

Arguments.Name: --prefer-ffmpeg
Arguments.Description: Prefer ffmpeg over avconv for running the postprocessors (default)

Arguments.Name: --ffmpeg-location
Arguments.Description: Location of the ffmpeg/avconv binary; either the path to the binary or its containing directory

Arguments.Name: --exec
Arguments.Description: Execute a command on the file after downloading and post-processing, similar to find's -exec syntax

Arguments.Name: --convert-subs
Arguments.Description: Convert the subtitles to other format
